verses.kjv: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
verses.ct: God, why have you rejected us permanently? Why does your anger burn against the flock you shepherd?

verses.kjv: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.
verses.ct: Remember your people, whom you claimed as your own long ago — the tribe you rescued to be your inheritance — this Mount Zion where you made your home.

verses.kjv: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.
verses.ct: Walk through these endless ruins; see everything the enemy has destroyed in your holy place.

verses.kjv: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.
verses.ct: Your enemies roared inside your meeting place; they raised their own banners as symbols of victory.

verses.kjv: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.
verses.ct: They acted like woodsmen swinging axes into a thick forest.

verses.kjv: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.
verses.ct: They smashed all the carved woodwork to pieces with axes and hammers.

verses.kjv: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.
verses.ct: They set your sanctuary on fire; they tore down and desecrated the place where your name dwells, leveling it to the ground.

verses.kjv: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.
verses.ct: They told themselves, 'We will crush them completely.' They burned every place of worship dedicated to God throughout the land.

verses.kjv: We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.
verses.ct: We no longer see any signs from you. There are no prophets left, and none of us knows how long this will last.

verses.kjv: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?
verses.ct: God, how long will the enemy mock you? Will the opponent insult your name forever?

verses.kjv: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.
verses.ct: Why do you hold back your power — your mighty right hand? Pull it from your side and act!

verses.kjv: For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
verses.ct: Yet God has been my King since ancient times, accomplishing salvation across the earth.

verses.kjv: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
verses.ct: You split the sea apart by your power; you crushed the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.

verses.kjv: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
verses.ct: You shattered the heads of Leviathan and gave its flesh as food to the creatures of the wilderness.

verses.kjv: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.
verses.ct: You opened up springs and streams; you dried up rivers that never stopped flowing.

verses.kjv: The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
verses.ct: The day belongs to you, and the night belongs to you as well; you established the moon and the sun.

verses.kjv: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.
verses.ct: You fixed every boundary on the earth; you made both summer and winter.

verses.kjv: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O LORD, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.
verses.ct: Remember this, LORD — the enemy has mocked you, and foolish people have insulted your name.

verses.kjv: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.
verses.ct: Don't hand over the soul of your dove to a pack of wild predators; don't forget your suffering people forever.

verses.kjv: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.
verses.ct: Honor your covenant, because the dark corners of the land are filled with places of violence.

verses.kjv: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.
verses.ct: Don't let the crushed and broken turn away in shame; let the poor and desperate praise your name.

verses.kjv: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.
verses.ct: Rise up, God, and defend your own cause! Remember how fools ridicule you all day long.

verses.kjv: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.
verses.ct: Don't ignore the shouting of your enemies; the uproar of those who oppose you never stops growing.
